meta.description: IASS Hawaii Lounge at Daniel K. Inouye Honolulu International Airport (HNL), Terminal 2. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: IASS Hawaii Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Proceed towards E Gates, Garden Court Area. Proceed to the Ground Level and follow signs to the entrance.

airport.name: Daniel K. Inouye Honolulu International Airport

lounge.description: Relax and unwind in paradise islandâ€™s oasis before returning home from your much needed vacation. Sit back, enjoy a refreshing cup of juice or water, and converse with your traveling companions in a comfortable setting. Wi-Fi is fast and free, providing you with a great opportunity to get some work done during your downtime.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.

reviews.content: Probably the worst lounge there is.
No frills lounge with decent AC. Quiet and clean for my 3 year old to enjoy anime on the TV. Not sure if itâ€™s worth a detour, but for a free entry with Priority Pass and next to my E gate, not bad.
Donâ€™t waste your time. Had a Diet Coke, thatâ€™s it. No AC. Seriously rethinking Priority Pass and credit card choices. Feb 15, 2020
No food, small space and limited outlets.
Unfortunately I canâ€™t give zero stars. NO BATHROOM! No food. No nothing.
Hands down the worst lounge by far I have ever been in. Itâ€™s not worth the elevator ride down one level. How bad can it be?  Itâ€™s a private lounge.  Iâ€™d rather sit at the gate. Just sad.
Whatever your expectations, itâ€™s worse.
Ridiculous. Why even bother? This is not worth anyoneâ€™s time.

Lounge couldn't be worse. How is this place is even open? The smell is moldy makes you sick walking in. No food, just basic drinks, dirty 1945 furniture. Shut it down please! PLEASE DO NOT SUPPORT IT!!
What lounge closes at 6 at an airport!? Not much there anyways.
Thereâ€™s nothing here. Just free water and uncomfortable chairs.
Come on, closed at 6pm? Way too early.
Decided to go even though had bad reviews, wish I didnâ€™t. No restroom, no snacks.
This has got to be one of the worst lounges I've been to. Its damp, dark, no snack in the morning and no alcohol. This lounge is for credit card holders, and can oddly get packed. Not worth it.
Very hot compared to the main terminal despite having the A/C in, no alcohol. Would rather pay to have a beer in the cool air upstairs.
Es un salÃ³n muy antiguo y pequeÃ±o. Una de las empleadas del front desk no me atendiÃ³ para nada bien cuando quise ingresar con Priority Pass.
Only a few soft drinks, juices, and coffees. Sort of smells like urine.
Just some chairs, nothing more. HNL is spacious enough and with actual dining that I just left.
Nice view of the garden but not a great drink selection.
One of the worst lounge ever, don't bother. The wifi is so bad. I'm writing this review using my phone data. And no food, drink is only water, soft drink, guava drink, and coffee.
Closes at 6pm. No food. Waste of time and money.
No food or snacks, total waste of time.

Not much to this room. Entry OK with Priority Pass. Thereâ€™s plenty of seating available and a fridge with some cold drinks. Grab a water or guava drink and make a call. Otherwise no need to stop by.
Probably the most basic lounge I have ever been in. Strange hours (closes for a half hour midday) and limited options. Staff is very friendly though.
Super dark. The gates are nicer...
Super small, odd hours, zero food, not even snacks..only small fridge with few drinks.  Basically quiet with free wifi..out of way, hard to find too.
This is an extremely small lounge. The air conditioning works great & staff was friendly but almost every single seat was taken. Wifi, coffee, tea, water, Coke, Sprite & guava juice- that's it.
Hot and no amenities. It is not worth going to this place.
A substandard lounge.  Quite warm. Challenging to find. Closes midday for 30 minutes. Only plus is they do have cans of soft drinks. No food identified. Oh, more newspapers than expected ðŸ˜€
Dark, musty, humid, 78 degree, very dated lounge with sodas, coffee, fruit drinks. Very filthy restroom at end of outside walkway, which is extremely dirty. I found the terminal restrooms cleaner!!!
I'm surprised this is still open. Old 70's rattan furniture, no food, only self service drinks. If I paid for this I'd cry. It's only saving grace is it's quiet and always has room.
Worst lounge ever. Main terminal area was more comfortable. This lounge was hot and muggy. Epic fail.
One of the worst lounges I have been to. The room was small and crowded. Only offered soft drinks, water, and coffee. No alcohol or snacks.
Don't even bother. Only thing they have is coffee, tea, and soft drinks. Such a disappointment :(
"We are closing in ten minutes. You aren't allowed to take drinks with you. But we will let you take drinks this time." So I left with two bottles of water.
Watch out for the strange hours...the middle of the day close out is VERY inconvenient.
Very pleasant front desk staff, but the lounge doesn't offer much except for soft drinks and seats.
The lounge is clean but offers nothing outside of coffee and Asian fruit drinks.
Exactly as pictured. No frills lounge but good wi-fi. At HNL, there is only paid wi-fi so it's worth the walk if you have complementary access. Coffee is from a Keurig and canned sodas available.
Useless Lounge. Only has soda and coffee. No snacks or any food whatsoever. Paid $29 for nothing. Total waste of time and money.
Nothing special - no food, minimal soft drinks. As others have mentioned, more like a doctor's office waiting room than an airline lounge.
Very minimal. The garden outside is nice.
The saddest lounge I have ever seen. The lounge in work buildings are better!
Well, they have upgraded the TV to a flat screen but that's it. Like a doctor's office and that's about it.
This place is truly awful. 40 chairs arranged doctor waiting room style. Coffee and some sodas and an old cathode ray TV with Japanese TV. The best thing? They close half an hour for lunch! Avoid!
I literally walked in the front door and thought I was at my doctor's. The smell, the decor... je ne sais quoi!
Basic lounge, no alcohol but coffee and soft drinks.
Simply the worst lounge I ever been to until today.  It has about 30-40 chairs arranged tightly together. A coffee pot and personal size soda cooler is all they have.
Good if you want to grab a quick non-alcoholic beverage (bottled water, coke, diet coke, sprite, juice), but the air conditioning wasn't that great mid-day. Hours are posted as 07:30-13:30.
Not much to this lounge. No food selection, some drinks available, wifi is free. That's about it.
Not worth the trip downstairs. Very odd hours (and opened later than stated time when I visited - staff opened door 15 mins late). Poor selection. Go to United lounge in other terminal (10min walk).
Only non-alcohol drinks and wifi, no snacks, TV is in Japanese. Simple lounge but clean and quiet.
An old looking lounge that's not even worth going into. Seems like it was furnished with old furniture that meant to be thrown away.
They don't take Hawaiian Gold status. Only Amex Japan. Boo.

This lounge looks fairly dated, kind of like a doctor's office's waiting area with floral print lounge chairs. The staff is helpful, though, and offers you a refreshment and the WiFi pw upon check-in.
Incredibly outdated lounge that looks like the 1970's inside. There are few amenities, and the furniture is like that found in Motel 6.
The views out on to the garden are very nice and give the lounge a bright and airy feel. Come for the views, not a meal - food is not a strong suit.
